revised_title: A New Apparatus for Fine Measurement in Wavelengths of Light
tldr: The author presents a new instrument for measuring fine differences in wavelengths of light, primarily designed as a comparator for measuring the difference between a standard of length and a duplicate bar. The instrument uses the principle of interferometry and can measure the movement of interference bands to determine the difference in lengths. This method is simple and offers high precision, making it a valuable tool for measuring standards of length.
